bug.author: nthmost
bug.summary: Streamlit 0.49.0 on Windows + Python 3.8 fails to execute (Tornado error)
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
Streamlit fails to execute on Windows under Python 3.8 due to a bug in Tornado. The version of Tornado pinned in streamlit 0.49 was 5.x, while the latest version of Tornado at the time of this bug was 6.0.3. <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/58422817/jupyter-notebook-with-python-3-8-notimplementederror>A similar bug was found in IPython notebook.</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug:
Setup Python 3.8 virtualenv on Windows Install streamlit 0.49.0 streamlit hello
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Streamlit hello should run. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Streamlit fails to execute, spitting out the following (tail end of traceback -- <denchmark-link:https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/streamlit-issue-when-calling-streamlit/724>see full traceback here</denchmark-link> ): <denchmark-code>self._handlers[sock.fileno()] = add_accept_handler( File “c:\users\admin\appdata\local\programs\python\python38-32\lib\site-packages\tornado\netutil.py”, line 268, in add_accept_handler io_loop.add_handler(sock, accept_handler, IOLoop.READ) File “c:\users\admin\appdata\local\programs\python\python38-32\lib\site-packages\tornado\platform\asyncio.py”, line 79, in add_handler self.asyncio_loop.add_reader( File “c:\users\admin\appdata\local\programs\python\python38-32\lib\asyncio\events.py”, line 501, in add_reader raise NotImplementedError NotImplementedError </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
No; Python 3.8 hasn't been officially supported in Streamlit to date. (But it should work.) <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.49.0 Python version: 3.8 Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? Pex? any OS version: Windows (probably any) Browser version: n/a
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
Using Python 3.7.5 is the recommended solution for now. See <denchmark-link:https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/streamlit-issue-when-calling-streamlit/724/4>https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/streamlit-issue-when-calling-streamlit/724/4</denchmark-link>
